did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Communications Workers of America, New Jersey Traffic Division #55, CIO and New Jersey Bell Telephone Company Records, 1950
did.origination:
Communications Workers of America (CWA);
New Jersey Bell Telephone Company
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: This collection consists of 1 transcript volume, 32 company exhibits, and 81 union exhibits concerning a dispute between the New Jersey Bell Telephone Company and the Communications Workers of America, New Jersey Traffic Division 55.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: This was a board appointed by the Governor of New Jersey under Public Laws of 1946, Chapter 38 of the State of New Jersey, which applied to public utilities. Negotiations for a renewal of the contract which expired in May were begun in March. Five basic issues were presented to the panel, a general wage increase, reduction of the work day, reduction in the length of the wage progression, pensions and the union shop. The Board was compsed of Professor Emmanuel Stein as the public representative, Hart T. Sweeney, Company Representative, Alexander Eltman, the union representative.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 1 transcript volume, 32 company exhibits, and 81 union exhibits.
